head_text.subj: ARCHIVE NEWS FOOTAGE... VERY REAL AND AUTHENTIC.

text: An AERIAL SHOT THROUGH THE LENS OF A TV NEWS CAMERA... ...of a structure... a roadside motel, sitting along a si road, surrounded by a vast, empty, brown wasteland. The image trembles... the 0.S. RUMBLE OF HELICOPTER BLADES WHIRLING. SEVERAL NEWS VANS, POLICE CARS, AND AMBULANCES are parked around the motel... PEOPLE mil about the scene. Behind the motel, a BACK-HOE tears into the ground. COPS circle the back-hoe, digging with shovels.

This is a live shot of the Prairie View Motel, in the eastern side of McKinley County. We've been told police have been working out here for several hours, but the details we're getting from them are sketchy at best. What we do know is that they've borrowed some equipment from a local farmer, and started digging in the rear of the property. What they're looking for though, we're not exactly sure. The camera shot shakily zooms in on the back-hoe, as the machine drags its teeth out of the earth... raises into t air... and a DIRT-COVERED CORPSE HANGS FROM THE METAL CLA
Oh, God!

...floating among the swarm of media... not really part o this circus... just observing it... weaving in and out of chaos... momentarily holding on a MALE REPORTER standing outside a motel room door. (CONTINUED)

The best we can come up with is that some video tapes have been discovered that are somehow connected to the bodies the Sheriff's Department has found buried on the property. As the reporter continues, our POV drifts to the MOTEL RO DOORWAY... the door just hanging on its hinges... furnitu inside SCATTERED ABOUT... BLOODSTAINS ON THE GROUND OUTSI THE DOOR.
Obviously they're being very tight- lipped with details at this stage, so we don't know yet the content of the tapes. Our POV floats to MASKED PARAMEDICS CARRYING BODY BAGS pa FEMALE REPORTER.

I've been told all the videos discovered are extremely violent and graphic. Our POV follows the paramedics past the female reporter.. over a BLOODHOUND stretching its leash to claw at the dir as if something's buried just beneath it... we continue t NEWS VAN. The side doors have been slid open, and POLICE crowd around the video equipment inside.
The police are actually using our Channel Nine truck to view what they believe is the most recently recorded tape. We glide over another REPORTER.
The images I saw on tape are horrific... unimaginable. The POV turns... to the back of the McKinley County SHERI being interviewed by a NEWSWOMAN for a television camera beyond them.
Sheriff, can you give us an idea of how many bodies have been found? (CONTINUED)
As of about a half-hour ago, we were at twenty-seven. But we haven't covered much ground yet.
So you expect to find more?
I'm afraid so, yes. Our POV drifts past a SMALL PILE OF FULL BODYBAGS...
And the vehicle that was found here... the BMW. ...and stops on a WRECKED BMW sitting beside the motel. W TIGHTEN ON THE CAR.
We ran a check on the car. It's registered to a David and Amy Fox, age 29 and 28, respectively. WE PAN DOWN TO THE DENTED CALIFORNIA LICENSE PLATE... hol it for a beat, as...
Can you tell us if they're related to any of this? As the female reporter's voice fades, we...

head_text.subj: ...THAT SAME CALIFORNIA LICENSE PLATE. ONLY IT'S SMOOTH A
UNMARKED. WE PULL BACK TO SEE THE FULL, PRISTINE BMW GLID
DOWN A DARK STRETCH OF ROAD.

text: I'd rather not say at this time.
DAVID FOX, (29), bloodshot eyes glazed over from a full d of driving, sits behind the wheel. AMY FOX, (28), sleeps the passenger seat. (CONTINUED)
And you need to think about the families before you start reading off names on air like that. David shakes his head, trying to loosen the cobwebs.

The middle of the night in the middle of nowhere. An endl span of empty rolling hills, dissected by a two-lane high A raccoon scampers out of the brush to some road-kill at center of the pavement. As the raccoon checks out the quality of the decaying rod a GLOW RISES OVER THE CREST... the BMW zooms up the pavem its lights blinding the animal.

David catches sight of the raccoon. And his reflexes are little slower than they were thirteen hours ago when he started this trek... but he manages to jerk the wheel... car vaults sideways. Amy's tossed out of her slumber, snaps awake with a painf start.
The BMW's tires squeal past the raccoon, just inches away They tear through the high grass... bounce over a rock... a ditch.
David pulls the car out of the ditch and back onto the ro He steadies the wheel.
Son of a bitch! He glances in the rearview... sees the raccoon shuffle ba into the brush. David looks at Amy. She's staring back at him, not as hap as the raccoon. (CONTINUED)
There was a raccoon in the middle of the road.
Better to kill us than get a little road-kill on the new car, huh?

We're still alive, Amy. I can tell by the pissy look you're giving me. Amy rolls her eyes, wipes the sleep from her face, grabs bottle of water and takes a drink before looking out the window at the passing bushes.
This isn't the interstate, David.
Taking a shortcut.
Through where?
New Mexico I think. Maybe Arizona. Same place really. A FAINT 0.S. CLANK from under the car.
Did you hear that?
Hear wha... David holds up his hand, quieting Amy. He strains to list to the engine.
I think the engine made a noise. Amy throws a glance at the clock. It reads, "1:25".
It's kind of late for a breakdown. You should have stopped somewhere earlier. David doesn't hear anything else... shrugs. (CONTINUED)
I popped some of those trucker pills back in Texas. Thought I could make it all the way.
Whatever it takes to get this trip over with as quickly as possible. Amy turns back to the window. David stares straight ahead There's not much love in this car.
You want a snack or something? There are some chips left in the back.
I'm fine. Amy pulls an apple and knife from a bag... cuts a chunk o of the apple. She offers it to David. He shakes his head and she pops it in her mouth.
You were really dreaming over there earlier. Mumbling and jerking around.
I dreamt you were trying to kill me. We were at my parent's anniversary party, and my mother wouldn't stop talking. You started screaming you couldn't take it anymore, and you tried to strangle me.

I'd never do that. Although the thought of strangling your mother did cross my mind. (beat) But at least you were dreaming about me, that's an improvement. Go on back to sleep. Maybe next I'll sexually assault you. David grins. Amy doesn't see the joke... just keeps worki on the apple. The knife slices into it... just as the car BOUNCES OVER A POTHOLE. (CONTINUED)
The knife slips off the apple... cuts across Amy's finger
Shit. Amy sticks her finger into her mouth... tries to suck the pain away.
You okay? (off Amy's nod) I keep telling you how stupid that is. Just bite the apple like the rest of the world.
Hurts my teeth.
As bad as cutting your finger off? Amy tosses the bloody apple and knife back into the bag, checks out the wound. Just a small cut.
It's not anything. She pulls a bandaid from the glove compartment... wraps i around her finger.
You want me to drive for a while?

I'm good. Go on back to sleep. David reaches up and turns on the radio... flips through stations... all the same... STATIC. David digs through his CD wallet... sees one that makes h smile, and pulls it out... slides it into the player THE CHILDREN'S SONG... "Hush Little Baby" begins playing.

"Hush little baby, don't say a word. Mama's gonna buy you a mockingbird. And if that mockingbird don't sing, Daddy's gonna buy you a diamond ring." Amy hears it... throws an angry glare at David. (CONTINUED)
Why do you have that?
I don't know. I guess I like to hear it. (off Amy's grunt) You deal your way, Amy, and I'll deal mine, okay?
"And if that looking glass gets broke, Mama's gonna buy you a..." Amy can't take it anymore... flips the stereo off and tur back toward the darkness of the night.
He's gone.
At one-thirty in the middle of goddamn nowhere, I'll take whatever I can get.

It's been a year. You should know by now that all we've got left is each other. (beat) And that's not even close to enough. TIGHT ON AMY'S REFLECTION IN THE WINDOW... ...Staring out into the night. She slips her injured fing back into her mouth.
The BMW glides down the road, its taillights fading into darkness.
Another stretch of road. If possible, this one seems even more desolate than the last. The BMW moves slowly along the road, making a DEFINITE CLANKING NOISE.  VACANCY 3-23-06 9.
Amy has an atlas open in her lap. David taps one of the narrow roads, winding across the page.
That should be us about there.
Why didn't you just stay on the interstate?
I don't know, I guess I just wanted to make this as miserable as possible. See just how big a bitch you could be about it. David stares down the road. His angry face softens a bit.
I thought this would be faster. The GRIND OF METAL ON METAL from under the hood. David grimaces.
Shit. Amy squints out through the windshield and points.
Is that something? The glow of a light ahead of them. They drive closer... ...the faded, old fluorescent sign of a service station d into view.

A small, paint-peeled building from the Forties, with a single gas pump sitting out front. There are several LARG FIREWORKS SIGNS hanging along the roof. One of the hand- painted signs reads, “Every day is the Fourth Of July at Small’s”. The BMW cruises past the pump... rolls over a hose that r across the ground. A LOUD RING ERUPTS as the tires bounce over the hose. (CONTINUED)
The BMW stops beside the pump.
David and Amy stare at the old building. Its windows are dark.
Guess they're probably closed.
Since 1957. David glances out at the pump.
Too bad. Good price on gas. They go back to the atlas.
I remember going through that place there... Elida. You were asleep... probably two or three hours ago, maybe.
Then that has to put us down here somewhere.
There's a town... Downey. Gotta be a real car place there.
If that's really where we are. David glances at the LED COMPASS in the dash.

We're headed west. Eventually we have to hit California. Amy shrugs... looks up from the atlas and sees a FACE sta in David's window. She SCREAMS. David spins and sees the face of the garage MECHANIC, (20 good-looking.
Sorry. (CONTINUED)
David restarts his heart... rolls down his window.
Just don't get much business around here. Wanted to make sure I got to you before you left. But I've gotta warn you, the gas price is a little steeper than the sign says.
Actually, we're just having a little engine problem. I dodged a raccoon a few miles back.
And we're lost.

She's lost. I know right where I am. We're on our way to Downey. David points down the road. The Mechanic nods... tries to subtly motion his head the opposite direction of David's finger. It takes a few times before David catches on. And Amy already has.
He's trying to tell you it's the other way, David.
Yeah. Sorry. But it's real easy to get turned around out here without a map. Amy holds up their map.
Oh. Well, Downey's about thirty miles back. David ignores Amy's smirk.
If you wanna pop the hood, I'll take a look to make sure you'll get that far.
I hate to bother you with it this late. (CONTINUED)
It’s no bother at all. David pulls the hood lever, then climbs out with the Mechanic.
The Mechanic starts examining the engine.
I went off the road... with the raccoon. Think I hit a low spot.
Looks like it, yeah. The Mechanic reaches in... tinkers with the engine.
Can you hit the gas for me? David hurries around the car.
David climbs in... hits the gas. He and Amy peer under th crack of the open hood, watching the Mechanic's hands mov around the engine... pull a wrench from his pocket... rea back under the hood.
Can he fix it?
(shrugs, to the Mechanic) What do you think? The Mechanic slams the hood.
Fan blade's bent. Rock musta hit it. She'll still drive fine. Just noisy is all. The Mechanic walks back to David's window. (CONTINUED)
You might wanna have somebody smarter than me check it when you get where you're goin' though.
I'll do that, thanks. What do I owe you?
We're good. I should pay you for finally giving me something to do. Now do you need to know how to get back to Downey?
Actually, if you could point us back to the interstate... we're trying to get to California.
You don't want Downey then. David feels Amy's eyes burning into his back. The Mechanic points down the road.

About seven miles down, there'll be a road on your right with a grove of trees beside it. Take that and keep goin' till you hit Westcliff. You'll run into a four lane there. Hang a left on that and it'll take you right back where you need to be.
Thanks a lot. David pulls a twenty dollar bill from his pocket and hold out the window.

Here. This way I won't feel guilty for dragging you out here so late. The Mechanic shrugs... takes the money. Then he reaches i his back pocket... pulls out a sparkler. He flicks his cigarette lighter... ignites the sparkler (CONTINUED)
You just bought yourself a twenty dollar sparkler. The Mechanic leans in David's window... hands it to Amy. gingerly takes it.
Every day's the Fourth Of July at Small’s. The Mechanic rolls his eyes and motions to the sign.
The owner makes me say that. (waves) Drive careful. Amy waves the sparkler out the window, as David pulls out
Amy grins, as she watches the sparkler shoot out the flam dots. It's not a smile we've seen from Amy, and David notices.
Guess I should go buy a box of sparklers, huh? Amy doesn't answer. Her smile fades with the sparks. She drops the charred black stick to her feet.
The BMW cruises down the road.
David points ahead of them to the grove of trees and the road veering past them.
There we go.
The BMW turns down the side road.  VACANCY 3-23-06 15.
Amy glances at the map, as David drives.
How far did he say this Westcliff place was?
He didn't. Suddenly, the car lurches forward a bit.
What was that?
I don't know. Did we hit something? Amy turns... there's nothing in the road.
I don't see anything. Another lurch... the engine skips.
What the hell? And now the engine more than skips, it dies. David pulls onto the shoulder.
Son of a bitch. David twists the ignition. The engine just turns over and over without starting.
Son of a bitch! So much for being able to keep driving it. David tries again... no luck.
Shit! Amy pulls out her cell phone... holds it up... NO SIGNAL. (CONTINUED)
Nothing. David turns the key again... just that sickening groan.
Dammit!
Can't a car run without a fan?
Evidently not. David pounds the steering wheel and climbs out of the car
The BMW's hood is already up from where David has tried t work on the engine. David leans back under the hood.
Try it again.
It's not going to work. David taps at the engine with a PLASTIC TRAVEL MUG... he' mechanic.
How do you know? Jesus, just try it.

Amy leans over and turns the key, as she watches David po all over the engine with the handle of the mug. The engine WHIRRS over and over... doesn't start. David finally SLAMS THE MUG AGAINST THE ENGINE. The mug shatters.
Amy almost smiles... she knew it.  VACANCY 3-23-06 17.
David kicks at the ground, grabs the remains of the mug a heaves them into the bushes. He looks up and down the road.
How far back was that station?
Five or six miles maybe. Too far to walk at night.
That means we sit here the rest of the night. Hope some idiots like us happen to drive down this stagecoach trail.
Idiot like you, not us. I didn't get us lost.

No, you slept through five states thanks to your prozac/zoloft cocktail. Amy flips David off through the window. He walks out to t center of the road, and SCREAMS. A flock of startled birds burst from a tree... scatter up into the night sky. David sees something... walks a few yards down the road, lifts a TATTERED WOODEN SIGN from the high grass. Handpainted across it, "Prairie View Motel. One mile ahea David holds the sign up toward Amy in the car.
You feel like walking a mile?

head_text.subj: TIGHT ON DAVID AND AMY'S FEET...

text: ...Walking along the black tar pavement. (CONTINUED)
move ahead, VACANCY 3-23-06 18. David gazes up at the star-filled sky.
I never see stars anymore. Not in L.A. (off their surroundings) Kind of nice out here really. I bet Charlie would've like it.
Should've brought him sometime. But we never went anywhere, remember? The job was always too important to leave.
Why do you do that?
What?
Every time I mention his name, you take a shot at me.
Stop mentioning his name.
I'm not like you, Amy. I don't want to forget our son so the pain will go away.
Aren't you the brave one, David. Amy picks up her pace... leaves David behind. then veers off the road into a cluster of unzips and starts taking a piss.

(under his breath) Such a bitch. (louder, for Amy) Maybe you'd be happier if you tried talking about it, instead of acting like it never happened. Like Charlie never happened. The moon casts a bright glow over them as they make their down the road. He watches her (CONTINUED)

Amy just keeps walking. A few feet away from David, the BUSHES RATTLE. David squints toward the sound, but it's too dark and too overgrown to see what's in there. As he finishes up, the BUSHES RATTLE AGAIN... this time louder David throws another nervous glance into the bushes... st nothing. He leans closer... ...just as a RACCOON darts out of the brush past him. David leaps back, startled. He catches his breath as the animal scurries away.

Goddamn raccoons are killing me. David turns... trots back toward the road after Amy. In the distance behind David, a FIGURE rises from the bus where David had just been. It's too far away to make out features. And the figure doesn't move... just watches Dav make his way down the road with Amy.

David and Amy stand in the gravel parking lot, staring at beaten down roadside motel. Eight rooms stretched out in L-shape. The Bates Motel... in need of a paint job. A primer painted PICKUP TRUCK sits outside the office, un a "$19.00 A NIGHT" sign that hangs over the office screen door. Above that is a crooked "VACANCY" sign.
We could go back to the car. You could sleep on the hood and stare up at those stars you love so much.
Maybe they'll have a phone we can use. They start toward the motel office.
A BELL above the screen door JINGLES, as David and Amy en (CONTINUED)

The tiny wood-paneled room has SEVERAL SECURITY VIDEO MONITORS on the walls behind the desk. The images of Davi and Amy entering the office fill the screens. Around the room, a few stock scenery pictures hanging on wall and a STUFFED JACK-A-LOPE, a rabbit with glued-on antlers, resting on the counter. At the rabbit's feet is DESK BELL, with a sign... "Ring Me". There's some MUFFLED 0.S. SCREAMING from the back room be the counter. David and Amy hear it... exchange a glance before David t the bell. There's some RUSTLING, then MASON, (40's), five foot nothing and hundred thirty pounds in his sweaty t-sh and jeans, appears from the back room.
Hey, folks. What can I do ya for?
(off the screams) Everything okay back there? Mason cocks his head, unsure. David motions to the back room. Mason grins and raises a TELEVISION REMOTE... hits button and the SCREAMS SILENCE.
Sorry about that. Gets a little boring around here late nights.
I bet so. Listen, our car broke down about a mile back. Just needed to borrow a phone... see if we could get a tow truck or something.
All we've got is that pay phone outside. Mason points through the window to an OLD PHONE BOOTH alo the motel wall.
She works off dimes if you need some. David digs a dollar from his pocket. Mason takes it and trades it for a cluster of dimes from his drawer (CONTINUED)
Trouble is the only garage within ninety miles is Smalls. Little place on Route Six.
Yeah. I think we stopped there earlier.
And Small's don't have a phone. David stares at Mason a beat, then down to the handful of dimes.
So I probably don't need these then.
Not if you need a tow truck. David throws a glance to Amy before filling his pocket wi dimes.
But I could run you back there in the morning if you want. Too late to do much right now no-ways. Amy looks at her watch... shrugs.
It's just a few hours.
Yeah, okay. Guess we'll need one of those nineteen dollar rooms then. Mason nods... looks David and Amy over, then grins.
I can give you two the Honeymoon Suite for twenty-four. Got a few extras that the others don't.
It's late. Regular room will do. Mason pulls a key from the hook behind him and slides it across the counter. (CONTINUED)
What the hell. I'll give it to ya for the same rate.
Okay, whatever. Thanks. David jerks out his credit card.
'Fraid we're not set up for plastic. Cash only.
Do you take dimes? Mason grins... doesn't get the joke. David snaps a twenty from the wallet and reaches for the key. Mason pulls the back.
And I need one of your ID's... sort of a deposit on the contents of the room.
Trust me, we're not going to take anything. I'm not up to carrying dirty towels a mile down the road.
I'm sure you won't. But rules is rules. I don't make 'em. I'm just the manager. It's too late for this shit. David pulls out his driver's license... trades it to Mason for the key.

It's the last one on the end there... number eight. Might have to jiggle the handle a bit to open her up. She's as sticky as an old whore. (to Amy) Excuse my language. Amy just turns and starts moving for the door.
Have a good night. (CONTINUED)
David waves over his shoulder as they walk out. Mason watches them head across the gravel lot, then turns disappears back into the back room. The 0.S. SCREAMS OF T HORROR FILM begin again.

Dark. Until the door opens and Amy flips the light switch David and Amy stand frozen in the doorway. Because this is rough. Stained shag carpet. Torn FARM ANIMAL PRINT CURTAINS. Cigarette holes are burned into th paisley bedspread draped across the bed. Artificial plants hang in the corners of the room.
Good thing we upgraded. David closes the door... locks it and HOOKS THE CHAIN ACR
Amy enters and hits the light in the bathroom, illuminati the broken tile floor, rusty faucets and water-stained commode.

We've had our tetanus shots, right? Amy pulls a bottle of PILLS from her purse, shakes a coup into her palm. She turns on the faucet. BROWN WATER splashes out, gushing SEVERAL ROACHES out wit it. The bugs scurry around the sink Amy turns the water off... watches the bugs slither down drain. She tosses the pills into her mouth... gulps them down.
Amy walks out, sees David flipping through a TV GUIDE.
If you want to know what shows were on during March of '97, I've got the answer. (CONTINUED)
David tosses the old magazine back to the table. Amy move to the bed and pulls back the covers... inspects the shee
I'm sleeping in my clothes.
I'm sleeping in my shoes. David glances around the room... moves to the closet... p open the door. It's empty.

Could be worse I guess. We could still be jammed into that twin bed at your parents' house... trying to pretend we're the happy couple. Amy slides onto the bed... props herself against the wall not getting too comfortable.
We should have told them about us.
Why ruin their party. We can tell them after we sign the papers. David climbs up beside Amy... stares at the farm print curtains.
What were you feeling... at the party... watching them celebrate being married all those years? A BEAT, then...
Pity. A LONG, QUIET BEAT THIS TIME.
Sorry about this. Should've stayed on the interstate.
Our one last great adventure together. (CONTINUED)
Did we ever have great adventures? I don't remember. Amy doesn't answer... just wraps her coat a little tighte around herself.
There had to be a couple. David leans closer... lightly kisses Amy's neck... up her skin toward her lips. Finally, Amy pulls away.
David, I can't.
You really want to quit on us?
It hurts too much. I'm sorry.
You can't just stop feeling because it hurts, Amy. Doesn't work that way.
That's all I can do. A KNOCK at the front door. David throws a pissed-off glan at his watch.
Who the hell is that? David goes to the door... pulls it open. No one is outside.
David leans out... checks both ways. Nobody.
Hello? No answer.  VACANCY 3-23-06 26.
David closes the door.
You heard that, right? Amy nods. Then ANOTHER KNOCK... this one down the wall... from the ADJOINING ROOM DOOR. David moves to the side door.
Yeah? MORE KNOCKS. David throws Amy a glance, then reaches to unbolt the loc
David, wait.
It's the room beside us.

I know. Hang ona... But David turns the bolt. The door swings open... ...and there's nothing but ANOTHER DOOR behind it. The ot room's door. No door handle for David to grab. The KNOCKING CONTINUES. David pounds back against their side of the partition.
What do you need? The knocking stops.
Hello? (to Amy) Were there any cars when we walked over? Amy goes to the window... squints outside. Just the OLD PICKUP TRUCK sitting outside the office. (CONTINUED)
There's a truck. Probably the office guy's. David taps on the door
Whoever's in there, it's too late for this shit. Then the other room's door begins to SHAKE... like whoeve on the other side is jerking hard on the handle.
What the hell is this?
Close the door, David. David just keeps watching the door vibrate.
Close the door! Amy pushes past David and SLAMS THEIR DOOR CLOSED. She bo it back secure.
Jesus! Why mess with them?
I'm not messing with them. I just want to know what they're doing. LOUD KNOCKS AT THE FRONT DOOR spin David and Amy. They exchange a glance, then David goes to the door.

Who is it? No answer. David secures the chain across the door, then eases it open... peers out through the crack. As Amy watches him, a POUNDING ERUPTS from the door besid her. She jumps with a start... backs away from it. David BEATS AGAINST THE WALL WITH HIS FIST.
What's your problem, asshole! The KNOCKING GETS LOUDER. (CONTINUED)
Screw this. David scans the room for a phone... there isn't one. He pushes back a desk... an empty phone jack sits in the wal
Perfect. David starts out the front door.
David, wait. But David's too mad to wait. He stomps outside.
David goes to the adjacent door... ROOM NUMBER SEVEN. He bangs on the door.
Open the door! No answer. David beats on it again.

Come on. You want to play games, lets play. David jerks on the handle... locked. He knocks again, and this time a KNOCKING answers him. Just like in the room.. slow, steady KNOCKING. David peers in the dark window... can't see who's behind door.
Real funny, jerkoff. David turns to Amy in the doorway.
Lock the door.
Where're you going?
To go shut this prick up. (CONTINUED)
David starts across the lot to the motel office. Amy disappears behind the door
Amy bolts the door... pulls the rusty chain across. She checks the lock on the adjoining room door, then hurries the window... watches David walk into the motel office.
David smacks the bell between the Jack-a-lope's feet over over. Mason leans out of the back room.
Everything all right, Mr. Fox?
No. The asshole in the room beside us keeps banging on the walls. He won't stop.
Beside you?
Yeah. Room seven. I went over to talk to him, but he just kept doing it. I don't know what his problem is.
That's strange. Mason turns to the RACK OF KEYS hanging behind the counte Key Number Seven is still there.
You're the only guests we got tonight.
Well somebody's in there.
You're sure it was number seven? (CONTINUED)
We're the last one and we're eight right? It's right beside us, with a big, rusty seven on the door, so I'm pretty sure, yeah.

Okay, I got ya. Every once a blue moon some drifter or college kids'1l crawl through a window for a night's sleep. Cleanin' lady'll find some trash layin' around... shit in the toilet. Don't usually cause no disturbance though.
Well this one is. Mason considers this a moment, then grabs the key.
I'll check her out for ya. David notices a PISTOL tucked on a shelf behind the count
If that works, you might think about bringing that. Mason grins... picks up the pistol and twirls it like a gunfighter.
I'm ass-tired of just shootin' at crows.
Good hunting.
Thanks, Mr. Fox. David walks out. Mason does a few more twirls with the gu
David strides out of the office, back into the darkness. sees Amy peering out between the curtains. David waves.  VACANCY 3-23-06 31.
Amy unlatches the door... opens it. David enters.
What'd he say?
Thinks it's just some drunk. He's going to take care of it. David closes the door... locks it back
Did you hear anything else?
No. I was almost wishing I would, so I'd know where they were.
Probably saw me heading for the office and took off. (glances around) Now we can enjoy this luxury resort with some peace and quiet. David gives the adjoining room door a smack, then falls o the bed.
Maybe we should just leave. Go back to the car.

I'm not walking anymore. Let's just gut it out for a few hours and catch a ride back. We'll get the car fixed and get the hell out. Amy doesn't like it, but just shrugs... sits down on the beside David. David grabs the remote.
You're not going to watch that now? (CONTINUED)

Just for a little while. Until we know our friend's gone from over there. Besides, gotta take advantage of the Honeymoon Suite perk. Worth at least an extra five bucks. David flips the television on... STATIC. He dances throug the channels... nothing but more static.
Maybe not.

With his six-shooter. He'll take care of it. Gotta keep his only two guests happy. David notices a VCR with SEVERAL VIDEO TAPES stacked on t of it. He grabs a tape... no label.

We're almost there. They keep crawling... sliding over the tiny bodies... unt finally, the SQUEAKS FADE. All we can hear is David and A breathing... desperately trying to make it to wherever th tunnel leads. (CONTINUED)
And then a SLIVER OF LIGHT appears ahead. David sees it.. his movement quickens.
I see something.
What is it?

Light. A door maybe. They drag themselves toward it... finally reach another 6 dirt box. David rolls out of the tunnel. He pulls Amy out, and she slaps away any remaining rodents. They stare up to a thin square-shaped crack of light above them.
(whispering) Where are we? David shakes his head... no idea. He presses up against t square... inches it upward.
...through the crack... scanning over the floor of a diml lit room... legs of furniture... a plate of half-eaten fo lies on the floor.

David lowers the square... holds a finger over his mouth Amy... not a sound. MAN’S VOICE (0.S.) I’1l give you money. As much as you want. We hear an 0.S. STRUGGLE... but it’s distant... false. David pushes the square up again... peers through the crack... widening... and that's when we see who's screaming... it's one of the snuff films playing on a VID MONITOR. A MAN is begging Killer One for his life.  VACANCY 3-23-06 64.

David rises up from the hole, pulling Amy up behind him. They see the LARGE PICTURE WINDOW overlooking the parking lot, and duck down out of sight They glance around the room... a wall of monitors, all displaying different angles of the Honeymoon Suite and mo grounds. Video cameras and equipment are piled all over t place. There are shelves of VHS TAPES lining the walls, each one hand-labeled... "Steve and Sharon S.", "Glen and Flo D.", "Brian and Alex P.". This is Mason's private collection. Another shelf is stacked full of dusty watches, jewelry, dolls, truck stop souvenirs, a collection of REARVIEW MIR

head_text.subj: CRUCIFIXES AND RABBITS FEET... DRIVERS LICENSES OF VARIOU

text: PEOPLE... all victims. This is a very creepy room... especially with the man's 0 PLEAS washing over the scene. They ease to the door... glance out into the MOTEL OFFICE
We're no better off than we were.
We're still alive. That's better David spins... starts digging through the mess.
There's gotta be something here we can use. Amy joins in... pulls back a blanket, revealing a TELEPHO
David. Amy grabs the phone... lifts the receiver... we hear the DIAL TONE. She dials “911”. We hear the RING along with her.
I tried that already. It was... And then... (CONTINUED)
MAN’S VOICE (V.0.) 911 emergency.
They’re trying to kill us. We're... The 0.S. JINGLE OF THE OFFICE DOOR OPENING freezes Amy. MAN’S VOICE (V.0.) What is your location, ma’am.
Mason hurries across the room with Killer One right behin him.
They didn't just disappear. Mason strides into the back room. And we enter with him.. expecting to see David and Amy sitting there waiting... ...but they're gone.
Mason moves to the wall of monitors... looks over all the angles.
They're out there somewhere. And then a MUFFLED VOICE...
Hello, Ma’am. Mason turns... sees the receiver lying on the floor. He picks it up.
I need your location. Mason TEARS THE CORD OUT OF THE WALL. He sees the CORNER THE RUG still flipped over above the trap door. He nods t Killer One.
Get down there after ‘em. (CONTINUED)

Killer One throws open the trap door. Mason goes to the picture window... sees Killer Two standing in the Honeymo Suite doorway. Mason motions behind Killer Two, to the bathroom... the t door. Then he points to the ground.
They're under us.
David and Amy are squirming... sliding... crawling throug the darkness... desperately trying to get to the other en that tunnel.

head_text.subj: KILLER TWO... CLIMBING INTO THE MOUTH FROM THE CEMENT BOX

text: ...dragging himself along the tiny passage.
...crawling as fast as they can. Their breathing is panic and fast. Amy keeps trying to glance behind them into the darkness. to what she knows is coming... but she can't turn... can' see.
...coming fast... moving smoothly through the tunnel. He' done this enough to be an expert.
KILLER Two... ...stopping... listening... hearing movement ahead, and pulling the knife from his belt before he continues on.
...their faces dripping with sweat... charging on into th black. No idea what's waiting just ahead of them.

...seeing a FAINT SHAPE ahead of him in the darkness. We can't make it out, but we all know it's Amy. Killer One pulls his knife... closes in on the shape. It grows closer... clearer... he readies the blade... pul it back as far as the tunnel will allow so he can drive i down into Amy... only a few feet away... slipping out of darkness... Killer One swings... then stops his motion ju in time... ...because it isn’t Amy. It’s Killer Two, with his knife ready to stab as well. They glance back... see the METAL GRATE PULLED DOWN FROM WALL.
...scrambling along the tunnel... finally reaching a RUST LADDER.  VACANCY 3-23-06 68.

A square of the plank floor lifts up. David and Amy climb out of the hole... find themselves inside a SMALL SHED. I filled with crates... shelves of tools... piles of old luggage. David closes the trap door
Help me. David pulls at a large crate. Amy pushes... until they've got it sitting on top of the trap door. David goes to the window.
The tool shed sits at the back of the parking lot. We see David's face appear in the dirty window.
David peers out the window.
We're at the other end of the lot Amy slides to the floor.
And they'll look for us here. Maybe not right away, but they will.
But we can't try to run. Not yet We have to let them think we've gotten away. Let them go after us. Then we can run.
What if they look in here first?
Jesus, Amy, I don't know. I'm doing the best I can here. (CONTINUED)
Amy nods... fights back tears. David sees it. He slides down... wraps his arms around her... pulls her close to h protecting her.
I'm sorry.
Nothing to be sorry for. I'm the one that left the interstate.
No, I mean about everything else... about us... about Charlie. I should have watched him closer... made sure the gate was up... that he didn't go near the stairs.
Shhhh. It isn't your fault. None of it was. It was an accident.
But he was so little. He thought I'd be there to catch him. I should've been there. And now Amy breaks down... sobs into David's chest.
Listen to me, you have to stop blaming yourself. Nobody else does. David pushes her back so he can look into her face.

We just have to get out of here first, okay? Everything starts over again once we make it out of this. Amy manages a nod. David kisses her. An 0.S. RUMBLE... TIRES OVER GRAVEL. David rises back up to the window... sees a HIGHWAY PATRO CAR pull into the lot.
Somebody else is out there. (CONTINUED)
Amy joins David at the window. They watch as a COP steps of the car.
The 911. Amy starts for the door. David grabs her... she looks at like he’s crazy. He motions out the window... to the smil Mason walking out of the office... shaking hands with the cop.
Or he’s one of them. Like the truck driver. David studies Mason and the cop talking.
You didn’t even tell them where we were. Why would they come?
Mason and the cop stand at the patrol car. cop There was a 911 call traced to this number.

Are you sure? It’s just me here tonight. The cop scans the area. CoP And you run the place? (off Mason’s nod) Then I won’t disturb anybody if I take a look around. The cop starts toward the motel rooms. Mason lags a step behind, throwing quick glances around the lot.
We don’t even have phones in these rooms. (CONTINUED)

cop I still need to check it out. The cop veers straight for the Honeymoon Suite. Mason pic up his pace... gets his hand to the door before the cop.. pulls the key from the wire on his belt and stretches it the door. He jiggles that sticky handle.

Shit, I forgot, this one works ona different key than the rest. Lemme run back to the office and grab it. Mason starts away. CoP Can I have that? (motions to the key) For the other rooms. Mason hesitates, then nods... tosses the key to the cop. Mason watches him move down to room 7... open the door. Mason spins toward the office.
David and Amy watch Mason trot into the office... watch t cop disappear into Room #7.
They're looking for us.
What if he’s here to help us?
He isn’t. That guy wouldn’t let him look around by himself like that. And I called 911 before, remember? It was them that answered.
The cop moves around the room... glances around the bed. CoP Hello? (CONTINUED)

No answer. He walks to the bathroom... flips on the light the room’s empty. He turns the light off... starts back for the door, then stops... looks to the adjoining room door... the door lea to the Honeymoon Suite. He flips the lock... pulls the door wide. And the Honeymoon Suite door is already open. CoP (CONT'D) Hello? He steps through the doorway.
The cop enters... scans over the room... the furniture to about... the shattered mirror pieces on the floor... the TRAP DOOR in the bathroom.

The cop walks into the bathroom... crouches beside the hole... leans in. And it’s too dark down there to see anything, so we’re ju waiting for one of the killers to come springing out of t hole, knife flailing. But they don’t. And the cop pulls his flashlight... aims the beam into th dirt hole. It’s empty. He studies it a beat, then stands... walks back into the room.

The cop moves past the overturned lamp, then glances up.. the TOWELS HANGING IN THE CORNERS. He pulls one of the towels away, REVEALING THE CAMERA. He stares back into the lens, DRAWING HIS GUN as he turns And there are the VIDEO TAPES SCATTERED ABOUT. (CONTINUED)
The cop goes to the television... turns it on and presses play on the VCR. TIGHT ON THE COP’S FACE... ...aS we HEAR THE 0.S. SCREAMS. He flinches at what he se Shock and fear wash over his face.
David and Amy stare through the window... see the Honeymo Suite door swing open... the cop step into the doorway, g in hand. His nervous eyes dart around the empty lot
He looks scared. David stares at the cop... tries to read what the cop’s thinking.

Maybe. I don’t know. And then a THUD, as someone POUNDS ON THE TRAP DOOR, lift the crate into the air. It SLAMS back to the floor. David and Amy spin to it, then look back to the cop... ...hustling toward his car
He’s going to leave, David. David’s frozen... unsure. ANOTHER THUD FROM THE TRAP DOOR
He’s going to leave! And David knows they don’t have a choice. He grabs Amy’s arm... throws open the door, and they charge out of the s
The cop hurries toward the patrol car.
The cop turns... sees David and Amy sprinting toward him, waving their arms. (CONTINUED)
The cop raises his gun toward them, then sees the terror their faces... their bodies covered in blood and dirt. And he’s seen the tapes... he knows what’s happened to th coP
David and Amy slide in the passenger side. The cop charge around to the other side.
The cop leaps inside... turns the key in the ignition... CLICK. He flips the key back... repeats... MORE CLICKS.

What's the matter with it? The cop shakes his head, then notices something... ...the hood is raised JUST A FEW INCHES... like someone worked on the engine then silently closed the hood. His eyes jump to the POLICE RADIO... gone... just wires.
They're not going to let us leave. CoP I’m not givin’ ‘em a choice. Stay here. The cop climbs out, his gun cocked and ready.

Wait! But the cop is already out. Amy reaches over, pounding th door lock down. David and Amy’s heads are snapping in all directions... looking for an attack. They watch through the windshield as the cop moves around front of the car, scanning the area as he lifts the hood. (CONTINUED)
The cop disappears behind the raised hood.
...moving across the engine... to the battery... and the SLICED BATTERY CABLES. TIGHT ON THE COP'S FACE... ...seeing the cables. CoP Shit.
...as he raises his hand up onto the hood... pulls it bac down.

David and Amy watching the cop reappear as the hood lower At that same moment, a SHAPE RISES UP FROM BEHIND THE COP KILLER ONE. David and Amy CRY OUT. The cop has an instant beat of confusion, as he sees them SCREAM. But then he knows... raises the gun as he starts spin... ...but Killer One SLAMS THE KNIFE INTO HIS BACK before he turn.

head_text.subj: THE FACES OF DAVID AND AMY...

text: ...Watching the murder in shocked horror. All the death they've seen on the video tapes is suddenly right in fron them... and very real. Amy continues to SCREAM. David throws the door open, as w hear the STABBING THUDS and the cop’S PAINFUL GROANS. David grabs Amy... pulls her out of the car with him.

David and Amy scramble out... see the cop’s legs lying in front of the patrol car... Killer One moving around the c toward them. They spin... see Mason standing at the center of the park lot, twirling his gun.

You just had to drag him into this didn’t you. You might as well have stuck that knife in him yourselves. Now here comes Killer Two walking out of the tool shed. David and Amy search for a place to run... all they have Mason and the killers closing in from all sides. So they take off back to the only place they have left... Honeymoon Suite.
David and Amy rush inside... slam the door closed behind them.

They killed him, David! They just killed him. Suddenly the front door swings open, and Killer One's fac jams through the crack. He reaches his hand up to snap th chain. David scoops up one of the shards of broken mirror from t floor raises it above his head to DRIVE IT INTO KILLER ON HAND. (CONTINUED)
Killer One CRIES OUT... pulls back his hand. David slams door closed again... bolts the lock. He points to the bed

Help me move it over! David and Amy drag the bed... jam it against the door. Da tips a dresser onto its side... shoves it across the floo and over the HOLE IN THE BATHROOM FLOOR, blocking it. He jams the shower rod over the dresser, wedging it against sink to secure the dresser against the floor.
They'11 find another way in.
I'm just trying to slow them down. David pulls open the adjoining room door... it's open int Room #7.
Come on! David and Amy rush through the doorway.
They sprint across the room... pull open the next adjoini room door, revealing the door to Room #6. David pushes against it... locked. David slams his shoulder into the door... nothing.
David looks around... spots the television. He grabs it jerks the cords loose from the wall, then carries it acro the room and THROWS IT THROUGH THE DOOR. The door splinters open.
Hurry! David and Amy race through the shattered door  VACANCY 3-23-06 78.
David and Amy charge into the room... race across it. Dav pulls open the next door, then KICKS THAT ADJOINING ROOM OPEN. They sprint into the next room.
David and Amy repeat it all again... blast their way into adjoining room... keep running.

...aS it shatters open. David and Amy pour into the room. race across it, then realize there are no more doors. David bolts the front door and secures the chain across i They grab a dresser... drag it over the floor and prop it against the adjoining room door, blocking it.
They'll be coming, David. (glancing around) Where do we go now? David searches the room. He hurries into the bathroom.
David goes to the window... turns the handle. The window cranks open... pushes the rusty nail over, and swings ope
Here. Amy enters... climbs up onto the commode to slide out. Bu the window's too small... no way to fit.
I can't. There's no way.
Just keep trying. (CONTINUED)
I'd barely get halfway out. You wouldn't even come close. David kicks up the bathroom rug, looking for another secr exit... nothing.
Shit.
David and Amy hurry back into the room. David peeks out t edge of the window.
I don't see them.
They're out there.
Maybe around the back... or underneath us. If I could make it to the office. He kept his gun there.
And he killed those people with it. What are the odds he put it back?

Better than they are of them not finding us if we just wait here. Then David glances up... notices something. The ceiling i made of foam tiles. He grabs a chair... climbs up and pus one of the tiles away.
David's head pokes up through the ceiling... scans the ar
This could work.
David drops back down. (CONTINUED)
What? David tears a shred off of Amy's shirt.
What are you doing? David goes into the bathroom.
David rushes to the window... jams the piece of material a sliver of splintered wood. The cloth hangs there... blo in the breeze.
Leaving them a trail.
David hurries back to the chair, motions Amy up.
They'll think you made it out the window. They won't look up there.
What about you?
I'll get to the office. To that asshole's gun.
It's not going to be there.
Something will be there. Something I can use.
No. You said you wouldn't leave me again.
It's just for a minute. Swear to God. Amy doesn't like this a bit, but she steps up onto the ch (CONTINUED)
You just have to stay real quiet up there, Amy. Amy nods... pulls herself upward. David takes her legs an shoves her up into the hole.
Amy rises into the attic... crawls over the wooden joists
Amy looks down from the hole.
Now pull the tile back over.
I don't want to do this, David.
We have to. It's our only shot. Amy starts pulling the tile back over the hole.
And you have to be quiet, baby. I mean not a sound. No matter what happens, you can't make a sound. Amy nods... looks like she's about to cry.
We're going to make it out of here.
Promise?
David's face stares up through the sliver of space at Amy
Promise. David motions for Amy to pull the tile across. As she doe David disappears. (CONTINUED)
Remember. Not a sound. Don't even move. Amy peers down through the cracks between the tiles... sh can see slivers of movement... David pushing the chair ba across the room.
David shoves the chair back under the desk... hears 0.S. RUSTLING from beyond the adjoining wall.
They're coming, Amy. TI have to go.
David?
They won't know you're up there. Stay quiet and they'll never know. David starts toward the door... stops and glances back to ceiling.

I love you. And then David pulls the chain... opens the front door... comes FACE TO FACE WITH KILLER Two. Before David can react, Killer Two draws his knife back.. swings an uppercut with it TIGHT ON DAVID'S FACE... ...as he GASPS... his eyes go wide. Killer Two shoves him back into the room... steps in afte him.
Amy stares down through the crack... sees David standing below her. (CONTINUED)
She wants to scream... instead throws a hand over her mou to silence a cry.
Killer Two moves close to David... nose to nose... raises knife again.
...as we hear DAVID'S AGONIZING MOAN. Through the cracks, Amy sees David crumble to his knees. Amy swallows a scream... watches with tear-filled eyes.
David GASPS... starts crawling out of the room. Killer Tw watches the pathetic attempt at escape. David struggles every inch... drags himself toward the op door.
David crawls out the door. He looks up.
...on a smiling Mason standing over David, holding a VIDE CAMERA to his eye.
...grainy and trembling... zoomed in on David's face star up at the camera... the life slipping away, until he fina slides to the ground.
(CONTINUED)
Mason lowers the camera... nods to the Killers in the doorway.
Let's get her out here and do this. Mason walks into the room.
Mason and the Killers scan the room... see the CLOTH FLAP IN THE WINDOW.
Find her. Killer One and Killer Two rush out of the room.

Amy sees Mason standing just below her. She's trembling s much that she can barely support herself. Finally, Mason walks out. Amy eases back over the joists. leans against the wall, pulling her knees up tightly to h chest. Tears pour down her face... she's all alone.
The sky is just beginning to brighten. The motel grounds empty and quiet.

The early morning sun slips through the attic slats. Amy crawls along the joists... peers through the ceiling tile cracks... no sign of anyone. Amy inches one of the tiles over... strains to get an ang on the room.
...on the empty room... at least what she can see of it.  VACANCY 3-23-06 85.

The ceiling tile inches to the side. Amy appears... climb down... hangs from the ceiling, scanning the room before drops to the floor. Amy lands as softly as she can... stays crouched on the floor, waiting for someone to come charging after her. Bu no one appears. Amy looks out the open front door... sees David's body st lying on the ground. Amy begins to convulse, as she fight the tears. She starts toward him.

...on Amy moving toward us. And then KILLER TWO STEPS OUT THE BATHROOM DOOR BEHIND AMY. Amy has no idea he's there. She keeps moving to David. And Killer Two keeps walking after her... PULLS THE KNIFE FROM HIS BELT. ANGLE ON AMY'S FACE... .. hearing the movement behind her She spins... sees Killer Two approaching.
Amy takes off out the door.
Amy races past David's body. She sees the BMW sitting tuc around the corner of the building. Amy charges toward it... throws open the door and leaps inside.  VACANCY 3-23-06 86.

Amy slams the door closed behind her... locks it. Reaches the ignition, and THERE'S A HOMEMADE KEY... A JAGGED SLIV OF METAL... JAMMED INTO IT. Amy turns the piece of metal. the engine TRIES TO CRANK...

Please... ...then ROARS TO LIFE. She throws it into gear... the car lurches forward. Amy spins the wheel... aims for the road ...Just as KILLER TWO'S FIST COMES SMASHING THROUGH HER WINDOW. Amy SCREAMS... tries to fight him off, but he's hanging o CRAWLING IN THROUGH THE BROKEN WINDOW ONTO AMY. She steps on the gas... the BMW PICKS UP SPEED. As they struggle, the steering wheel is JERKED SIDEWAYS.. the car takes a hard turn toward the MOTEL ROOMS. Killer Two's upper body is inside the window. He's clawin at Amy... choking her. And Amy's forgotten all about steering this car... she's just trying to escape... ...doesn't even see the Motel Room doorway approaching fast... or KILLER ONE RUSHING OUT OF THE DOORWAY TO SEE T COMMOTION... ...and finding THE GRILL OF THE BMW RIGHT ON TOP OF HIM. Killer One has no time to react before the car PLOWS INTO DOORWAY... SLAMS INTO HIM.

Concrete, plaster and wood erupt, as the front end of the crashes in, TEARING OUT THE FRONT WALL OF THE ROOM. And Killer One is pinned against the grill, as the BMW thrusts him backward.  VACANCY 3-23-06 87.

The car slams into the back wall, vaulting KILLER TWO OUT WINDOW. He sails forward, disappearing in the cloud of du and debris. The force throws Amy up into the windshield. The glass splinters around her. The jolt knocks the breath from her lungs. She rolls back down to the seat... tries to catch her breath... shake the dizziness away. Then she raises up... ...and there's KILLER ONE PEERING OVER THE FRONT END OF T BMW AT HER. Amy starts to scream... but then sees his body's frozen.. his face is lifeless. He's pinned between the car and the wall... crushed. Amy glances around for Killer Two... she can't see him. She turns the handmade key to restart the engine... it on CLICKS. She pounds her foot on the pedal... turns the key again... MORE CLICKS. Amy throws a nervous glance around, then opens her door.. climbs out... ...and here comes KILLER TWO RISING OUT OF THE RUBBLE... still GRIPPING HIS KNIFE. Amy scrambles back... trips among the debris. Killer Two keeps coming... slowly raising the knife. But then instead of swinging it down, the KNIFE SLIPS FROM HI HAND... tumbles to the floor. And then we see why... the THICK SHARD OF WOOD jutting ou his stomach. Blood seeps out around it. He falls to his knees... makes one last grab for Amy, then collapses dead beside her.
Amy looks down the open partition door... to Mason racing through the rooms toward her. Amy crawls over the wreckage... takes off out of the room  VACANCY 3-23-06 88.
Amy sprints across the gravel lot... reaches the PICKUP TRUCK. She looks inside... NO KEYS.
Mason runs into the room... sees the bodies of Killer One Killer Two. Tears fill his eyes.
Oh, Jesus. No. He bends down over Killer Two.
What did she do?

Amy races inside, locking the door behind her... peers ou hrough the window for some sign of Mason. He isn't out here. tet She hurries behind the counter... frantically searches th shelves for a gun... a weapon... keys... anything. ANGLE ON THE SECURITY MONITORS... ...Amy's onscreen, searching the office... finding nothin he runs into the back room. n

The television screen is filled with STATIC. Amy hurries through the mess... sinks to her knees beneath the large window... scans the area for Mason. He isn't there. he turns... shoves a dresser over onto the trap door, locking it. She grabs the phone... starts to dial, then tops... taps the buttons... follows the cord along the loor... to the SHREDDED END OF THE CORD. he grabs it... tries to shove it back into the wall jack s she fights with it, we pan up to the VIDEO MONITORS... he image of Mason WALKING OUT OF THE MOTEL ROOM.
o> ND AHTH (CONTINUED)

He strides out of frame... disappears... appears again in another monitor... closer... then vanishes again. We pan back to Amy, and she's too busy working on the pho to have seen him. But the cord is broken... useless. She throws another glance back out the window... nothing. And then the 0.S. JINGLE OF THE OFFICE DOOR OPENING. Amy freezes... grabs a VIDEO CAMERA TRIPOD, moves to the doorway... peeks around the edge. The OFFICE DOOR IS CRACKED OPEN. The breeze sways it back and forth, RINGING THE BELL. Amy readies the tripod in he hand... eases through the doorway.

Amy moves toward the door. Her eyes dance around, just waiting for Mason to spring upon her. But Mason doesn't show... and Amy's getting closer to the door, until she sprints the final steps... slams the door shut, bolting it. She spins... hurries back around the counter... through t doorway.

Amy rushes back into the room... moves to the window to l outside. And that's when the RUSTY TRASH CAN COMES FLYING THROUGH WINDOW, shattering the glass and knocking Amy back to the floor. The tripod flies from her hand... slides away. Mason leaps through the broken window. Amy reaches for th tripod, but Mason kicks her, sending her sprawling. Amy crawls for the door, but Mason kicks it closed and gr Amy by the hair... snaps her head back so she can get a g look at him.
You shoulda let my brothers kill you last night. (CONTINUED)
Mason SLAMS HIS HEAD AGAINST AMY'S... BAM... knocks her b to the floor. She sits on the dirty shag carpet, dazed.
...on Mason grabbing a VIDEO CAMERA from the table... plugging in some electrical equipment.
‘Cause we're gonna need at least two batteries to get everything I'm gonna do to you. Mason raises the video camera to his eye... the light on front FLASHES RED.
...on Amy staring half-conscious back at us. She can't sa anything. The barrel of Mason's gun rises to the edge of the frame. aims right at Amy.
Now tell me your name. A beat, as Amy gathers her thoughts, then...
Amy... Amy Fox.
Hello, Amy. You've done a lotta bad things here tonight, haven't you? Amy doesn't answer. We see Mason's thumb COCK THE HAMMER THE GUN... CLICK.
Haven't you, Amy? Amy finally nods. (CONTINUED)
Yes you have. But now you're gonna try and make up for all that aren't you? Amy nods again.
Trouble is, Amy, your clothes are all bloody. Don't you wanna look nice for everyone? Amy doesn't answer.
Take off your shirt, Amy. Amy shakes her head.
No. Mason waves the gun again.
That's the last time you say no to me. Amy's still so dazed... finally reaches for her buttons.. just nudges them... can't make her fingers work.
You can do it. But Amy can't. She's trying, but her fingers just won't cooperate.
Shit. Our POV drops to the floor, as Mason lowers the camera.
Mason goes to Amy, reaches out to unbutton her shirt hims And Amy's too out of it to even try to stop him. Mason gi her face a light smack
Now don't you pass out on me. I want you to know every little thing I'm doin' to you. (CONTINUED)

Amy's heavy arms just hang beside her, as Mason pops open first button. And that's when we realize Amy isn't as dazed as Mason an the rest of us thought she was. Her hand moves quickly... grabs the tripod and SLAMS IT AGAINST MASON'S HEAD. Mason stumbles back to the couch. Amy leaps to her feet charges to the door, throwing it open.

Amy runs through the doorway... starts around the counter but that's as far as she gets before Mason springs from t back room, tackling Amy against the counter. Mason grabs Amy by the hair... slams her head onto the counter over and over, RINGING THE BELL AT THE JACK-A-LOP FEET AGAIN AND AGAIN. He turns her around to press his gun against her head. As Amy spins, her hand finds the Jack-A-Lope... she swings i DRIVING THE ANTLERS INTO MASON'S SHOULDER. Mason GASPS... loses his grip on the gun... it tumbles across the counte the floor. Amy crawls over the counter... hits the floor and scrambl for the gun. Mason pulls the Jack-A-Lope out of his shoulder... charge around the counter and tackles Amy as she reaches the gun it slides across the floor They wrestle on the floor, trading blows... using lamps chairs, books... anything they can get their hands on... gaining, then losing control... almost getting their hand the gun before the other knocks them away.
